thread.title: Liverpool FC boss Jurgen Klopp's record same as Rodgers | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Liverpool FC boss Jurgen Klopp's record same as Rodgers | Daily Mail Online

author: Spencer Morgan For Mailonline
title: Liverpool FC boss Jurgen Klopp's record same as Rodgers | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Liverpool's 3-1 defeat by Leicester in the Premier League means Jurgen Klopp's record in the competition to this point is identical to that of predecessor Brendan Rodgers in his first 56 games. Klopp and Rodgers share a run of 27 wins, 16 draws and 13 defeats in their first 54 league matches in charge at Anfield. Earlier this season it had seemed that the German had brought new life to Merseyside but a slide since the turn of the year means he still needs to work to surpass the man he succeeded. Jurgen Klopp and Brendan Rodgers are dead-level in their first 54 Liverpool league games Rodgers guided Liverpool close to the Premier League title in 2013-14, finishing two points behind champions Manchester City despite a late dip. But Rodgers was sacked early in the last campaign with his team mired in 10th place. Klopp's October appointment helped them rise to eighth and the team had looked to be legitimate title contenders in the opening months of this season. RELATED ARTICLES
